Class MazeMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • MazeMap

  • public class MazeMap
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    2.0, May 17, 2014 This program will generate the map and return information about the map, such as if a certain tile is available to be moved onto by the player character (The tile would not be available if there was a wall there), the size of the map, the location of the player, the player's score at a given time, and more. Not only that, this program will also solve for the shortest path possible to complete the maze, which will be used to help calculate the score of the player.

    Variable Dictionary
    Name Type Purpose
    length int Stores the dimensions of the maze.
    tileX int Acts as a template to determine what the length-wise dimension of all the tiles should be.
    tileY int Acts as a template to determine what the height/width-wise dimension of all the tiles should be.
    steps int Stores the number of steps taken by the player.
    perfect int Stores the shortest distance possible for a particular map.
    maze BufferedImage Stores the image of the maze to be displayed during gameplay.
    tiles BufferedImage[] Stores the image of all the tiles that will be used to make the image of the maze.
    exit Point Stores the location of the exit.
    player Point Stores the current location of the player character on the map.

    Author:
    Daniel Chen

        Loops and Conditions

        names - Stores names of the maze tile files so that they can be accurately located and accessed.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When program does not properly access maze images or maze images do not exist.

        if (y < 0... This structure is used to check if a particular wall is existant or not.

        if (x < 0... This structure is used to check if a particular wall is existant or not.

        x - Variable storing the location's horizontal components.
        Returns:

      • generateTile

        public void generateTile(java.awt.Point loc,
                int direction)
        The purpose of this method is the generate the map.

        Loops and Conditions.
        while (... The purpose of this loop is to run recursively and generate the map.
        if (loc... The purpose of this structure is to make sure that the maze is legitimate.

        Parameters:
        neighbours - This variable stores all the possible locations that can be accessed from a particular tile.
        n - This variable stores a random number that will be used in generating the maze.
        d - This variable represents direction and is also used to help generate the maze. (Which alls to be removed in which direction.)
        newPoint - This variable represents a neighbour that is to be removed. (Randomly chosen with variable 'n'.)

      • newMap

        public void newMap(int length)
        The purpose of this method is to create a new map including the location of the exit (random location at the top of the screen/map), and the starting location at the centre/bottom of the screen. Furthermore, this method also resets the step counter counting the number of steps taken.

        Loops and Conditions
        for (int i... The purpose of this loop is to stitch pixel art tiles and the maze together.
        for (int n... The purpose of this loop is to stitch pixel art tiles and the maze together.

        Parameters:
        i - Loop counter for for loop.
        n - Loop counter for for loop.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(MazeTile m)
        The purpose of this method is to return the appropriate image for a particular position on the map. (Will return appropriate image with appropriate rotations to fit into map.)

        Loops and Conditions
        if (i ==...8) The purpose of this structure is to make sure the correct tiles are used for the correct placements on the map.
        if (i ==...14) The purpose of this structure is to make sure the correct rotations have been applied to the tile.

        Parameters:
        temp - Variable storing the maze tile image.
        r - Variable storing how many rotations a tile should have.
        i - Variable storing which tile should be used.
        m - Gives program access to variables and methods of MazeTile.
        Returns:
        The correct tile with proper rotations.

      • move

        public boolean move(int direction)
        The purpose of this method is to move the player around on the map based on which direction they chose to move in.

        Loops and Variables
        if (walls... The purpose of this structure is to check if there is a wall a particular direction on the tile the player is currently on.
        if (direction... The purpose of this structure is to check which neighbours are available and will move the player accordingly.

        Parameters:
        direction - This variable stores the direction the user chose to move in.
        walls - This variable stores all the walls around the player at a given moment.
        Returns:
        Whether the player has moved or not. (Walking into a wall does not count.)
